snippet.title: California governor signs law preventing male circumcision ban
snippet.description:
* California Gov. Jerry Brown signed into law Sunday a bill that prevents local governments from banning the practice of male circumcision.
http://www.cnn.com/2011/10/02/health/california-circumcision-law/index.html

snippet.title: San Francisco judge removes circumcision ban from ballot
snippet.description:
* San Francisco residents will not be voting on whether male circumcisions should be banned in the city this fall.
http://www.cnn.com/2011/HEALTH/07/28/circumcision.ban.voting/index.html

snippet.title: San Francisco judge removes circumcision ban from ballot
snippet.description:
* San Francisco residents will not be voting on whether male circumcisions should be banned in the city this fall.
http://www.cnn.com/2011/POLITICS/07/28/circumcision.ban.vote/index.html

snippet.title: San Francisco to vote on male circumcision
snippet.description:
* San Francisco voters will decide whether to ban male circumcision in the November 8 municipal election. Activists gathered enough signatures to put a proposal on the ballot, the city's election board confirmed Wednesday. The measure aims to prohibit...
http://religion.blogs.cnn.com/2011/05/18/san-francisco-to-vote-on-male-circumcision/

snippet.title: 'Intactivists' to San Francisco: Ban circumcision
snippet.description:
* In the California city that banned Happy Meal toys,outlawed sitting on sidewalks during daylight hours and fined residents for not sorting garbage into recycling, compost and trash, Lloyd Schofield wants to add a new law to the books in San Francisco: A ban on all male circumcisions.
http://www.cnn.com/2010/HEALTH/11/19/male.circumcision.sf/index.html

snippet.title: Zulu king promotes circumcision to fight HIV/AIDS
snippet.description:
* In the Zulu heartland of South Africa, where more than one in seven people are HIV positive, a Zulu king is reviving the tradition of male circumcision in an effort to fight the spread of HIV.
http://www.cnn.com/2010/WORLD/africa/07/01/circumcision.south.africa.aids/index.html

snippet.title: Highlights from the world's press
snippet.description:
* The announcement yesterday about the results in two African studies of male circumcision may be the most important development in AIDS research since the debut of antiretroviral drugs more than a decade ago, says The New York Times.
http://www.cnn.com/2006/WORLD/europe/12/14/tbr.papers/index.html

snippet.title: A proposed bill to ban male circumcision
snippet.description:
* A San Diego, California-based group that calls itself a health and human rights organization recently submitted a proposed bill to Congress called the Male Genital Mutilation Bill ("MGM bill"). The bill, if adopted, would ban the practice of circumcising baby boys.
http://www.cnn.com/2005/LAW/04/08/colb.circumcision/index.html

snippet.title: Circumcision reduces risk of herpes and HPV infection
snippet.description:
* Men who are circumcised are less likely to get sexually transmitted infections such as genital herpes and human papillomavirus (HPV), but not syphilis, according to a study of adult African men published this week in the New England Journal of Medicine.
http://www.cnn.com/2009/HEALTH/03/26/healthmag.circumcision.hpv.herpes/index.html

snippet.title: California governor signs law preventing male circumcision ban
snippet.description:
* California Gov. Jerry Brown signed into law Sunday a bill that prevents local governments from banning the practice of male circumcision.
